text: Hana Elhebshi or Hana El Hebshi is a Libyan activist and architect. In 2012 she received the International Women of Courage Award. During the Libyan revolution, Hana advised NATO on strikes. She also made public how many people Gaddafi's government killed during the war. She did this under the name "Numidia". She also fought for women's rights in Libya. == References == == Other websites == * 2012 International Women of Courage Awards, U.S. State Department photostream on Flickr * Secretary's International Women of Courage Award (U.S. Department of State) Category:Living people Category:Architects Category:Libyan people Category:Women who received the International Women of Courage Award Category:1985 births Category:Women's rights activists
title: Hana El Hebshi
